titles.title: To amend title I of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to require clear and concise notification to participants and beneficiaries under a group health plan of the right of the employer to terminate such plan and to otherwise revise the type and amount of benefits provided thereunder, and to provide for civil enforcement of such requirement.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1940-1941)
Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and Labor

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Labor-Management Relations.

bill.summary: 8/2/1993--Introduced. Amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA) to require clear and concise notification to participants and beneficiaries under a group health plan of the employer's right to terminate the plan and to otherwise revise the type and amount of benefits. Provides for civil enforcement of such requirement.
